remarks: Properties showing that an element ` I ` is the identity element of a division ring.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Oct-2013.)
statement:
drngid2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
drngid2.t $e |- .x. = ( .r ` R ) $.
drngid2.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
drngid2.u $e |- .1. = ( 1r ` R ) $.
drngid2 $p |- ( R e. DivRing -> ( ( I e. B /\ I =/= .0. /\ ( I .x. I ) = I ) <-> .1. = I ) ) $.
